page.title: 19Tytherley's Vineyard.
page.content: In the village of West Tytherley there is a {Vineyard }owned by Mr. and Mrs. Donald.They have just under 6000 vines Their grapes are German white and they have a small trial of red grapes that seems promising. In a year they fill about 6700 bottles. After the grapes are picked, they are crushed in a big machine that came from France. To clear the wine, it is filtered.Next it is stored in three big drums where it is left for a year. The bottles are green.The corks are supplied from London. Wine is sold to South Africa,the USA, France, Germany and Australia.
